summary: All four requirements (REQ-48 through REQ-51) have been successfully implemented. The PWA manifest.json was created with appropriate metadata and teal theme color, index.html was updated with the manifest link, a QRCodeGenerator component was created with display and download functionality, and it was integrated into the AdminDashboard as a dedicated tab.

hallucinated_features.description: QR code uses teal color (#14b8a6) for the QR code dots themselves, not just border styling
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-50 specifies the QR code should be 'displayed in a card with teal borders matching the existing design theme' and 'styled consistently with the Flipkart-inspired teal design aesthetic'. The diff shows the QR code generation uses dark: '#14b8a6' for the QR code pattern itself, which goes beyond just card borders. While this maintains design consistency, it exceeds the literal requirement.

hallucinated_features.description: Loading state with spinner and 'Generating QR code...' message
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-50 does not specify any loading states or user feedback during QR code generation. The implementation includes an isGenerating state with a spinner animation and loading text, which is a feature addition not requested.

REQ-50 specifies download functionality but does not require toast notifications for success ('QR code downloaded successfully') or error states ('Failed to generate QR code', 'Failed to load QR code library', etc.). These are user experience enhancements beyond the stated requirements.

hallucinated_features.description: QR code icon (QrCode from lucide-react) in card header
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-50 does not specify including an icon in the QR code display card. The implementation adds a decorative QR code icon with background styling in the card header, which is a visual enhancement not explicitly requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Error correction level set to 'H' (high) for QR code generation
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-50 does not specify any error correction level requirements. The implementation sets errorCorrectionLevel to 'H', which is a technical implementation detail beyond the requirement scope.
